commits.message: docs: Add comprehensive type definition guidelines and verification
commits.body:
Added documentation and tooling to prevent path alias issues in
type definitions:

Documentation:
- .github/CONTRIBUTING.md: Full guidelines for type definitions
- .github/copilot-instructions.md: AI coding assistant rules
- docs/TYPE_DEFINITIONS.md: Quick reference guide

Tooling:
- scripts/verify-types.cjs: Pre-publish verification script
- package.json: Added verify:types to prepublishOnly hook

Fixes:
- src/lib/styleUtils.ts: Changed @/ to relative import

The verification script automatically checks for path aliases (@/)
in generated .d.ts files and fails the build if found. This prevents
publishing broken type definitions that don't work in consuming
projects.

All future contributions must follow the "relative imports for types"
pattern to ensure proper TypeScript support in external projects.

Changed Icon.tsx to import IconName from '../../../types/icons'

commits.message: fix: IconName type now works in consuming projects
commits.body:
- Created self-contained IconName type as string literal union
- Removed dependency on path aliases in type definitions
- Exported IconName and iconsData from main package
- Fixed TypeScript error where iconName resolved to 'never'

The previous implementation used `keyof typeof iconsData` which
referenced @/styles/icons.json via path alias. This worked internally
but failed in consuming projects because they couldn't resolve the
@/ path alias, causing IconName to evaluate as 'never'.

Now IconName is a proper string literal union type that provides
full autocomplete and type safety without any JSON imports.

commits.author: Common Origin
commits.message: fix(npm): correct repository URL for provenance validation
commits.body:
Fix NPM publishing error by updating repository URL in package.json to match
the actual GitHub repository name.

**Issue:**
NPM provenance validation was failing with:
"Error verifying sigstore provenance bundle: Failed to validate repository
information: package.json: 'repository.url' is 'git+https://github.com/
common-origin/design-system.git', expected to match 'https://github.com/
common-origin/common-origin-design-system' from provenance"

**Root Cause:**
- Package.json had outdated repository URL: design-system.git
- Actual GitHub repository: common-origin-design-system.git
- NPM provenance attestations require exact match for security verification

**Solution:**
Updated repository URL from:
- https://github.com/common-origin/design-system.git
To:
- https://github.com/common-origin/common-origin-design-system.git

This ensures NPM can verify the package provenance and authenticate the
source of the published package through GitHub Actions attestations.

Resolves: NPM publish 422 Unprocessable Entity error

commits.message: fix(npm): correct repository URL for provenance validation
commits.body:
Fix NPM publishing error by updating repository URL in package.json to match
the actual GitHub repository name.

**Issue:**
NPM provenance validation was failing with:
"Error verifying sigstore provenance bundle: Failed to validate repository
information: package.json: 'repository.url' is 'git+https://github.com/
common-origin/design-system.git', expected to match 'https://github.com/
common-origin/common-origin-design-system' from provenance"

**Root Cause:**
- Package.json had outdated repository URL: design-system.git
- Actual GitHub repository: common-origin-design-system.git
- NPM provenance attestations require exact match for security verification

**Solution:**
Updated repository URL from:
- https://github.com/common-origin/design-system.git
To:
- https://github.com/common-origin/common-origin-design-system.git

This ensures NPM can verify the package provenance and authenticate the
source of the published package through GitHub Actions attestations.

Resolves: NPM publish 422 Unprocessable Entity error
